sen.j: 西木津駅（にしきづえき）は、京都府木津川市相楽川ノ尻55番にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）片町線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located at 55 Saganaka Kawanoshiri, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, Nishi-Kizu Station is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Nishi-Kizu Station, located at 55 Saganaka Kawanoshiri, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Nishi-Kizu Station, located at 55 Saganaka Kawanoshiri, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 単式1面1線ホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is an aboveground station having a single platform, only one side of which is used for boarding and exiting trains.
It's an aboveground station having a single platform, only one side of which is used by passengers boarding and exiting trains.
It's an aboveground station having a single platform, only one side of which is used by passengers boarding and exiting trains.

sen.j: 棒線構造のため、木津方面行きと京橋方面行きの双方が同一ホームに発着する。
sen.e: Due to its bar-like structure, both trains for Kizu and Kyobashi start from and arrive at the same platform.
Due to its bar-like structure, trains for Kizu and Kyobashi start from and arrive at the same platform.
Due to its bar-like structure, trains for Kizu and Kyobashi start from and arrive at the same platform.

sen.j: ホーム長は4両分しかないが、2010年3月（2009年度末）を目処に当駅を含めた木津駅～同志社前駅間のホームが8両対応に延伸される予定で、7両編成が乗り入れる予定である。
sen.e: Although the current platform can support up to only 4 cars; however, platforms of the stations located between Kizu Station and Doshisha-mae Station, including this station accordingly, will be extended so that they can support up to 8 cars approximately by March 2010 (by the end of FY 2009), planning to operate 7-car trains.

Although the current platform can only support up to four cars, platforms of the stations located between Kizu Station and Doshisha-mae Station (including this station) will be extended by approximately March 2010 (the end of fiscal 2009) so that they can support up to eight cars, as part of a plan to operate seven-car trains.

Although the current platform can only support up to four cars, platforms of the stations located between Kizu Station and Doshishamae Station (including this station) will be extended by approximately March 2010 (the end of fiscal year 2009) so that they can support up to eight cars, as part of a plan to operate seven-car trains.
sen.cmt: JRのサイトより、Doshishamae としました。fiscal year 2009 としました。

sen.j: 無人駅で駅舎はなく、ホーム入口に逆U字型をしたゲート状の建造物があるのみで、そこに自動券売機や、ICOCA・Jスルーなどのための簡易改札機が設けられている。
sen.e: It is an unmanned station with no actual station building but has an inverted U-shaped structure at the entrance for the platform, in which an automatic ticket machine and a simple ticket gate for ICOCA and J Through Card are set up.

It's an unmanned station that has no actual station building but has an inverted U-shaped structure at the entrance to the platform, in which an automatic ticket machine and a simple ticket gate for ICOCA and J Through Card are in place.

It's an unmanned station that has no actual station building but has an inverted U-shaped structure at the entrance to the platform, in which an automatic ticket machine and a simple ticket gate for ICOCA and J-Through Card are in place.

sen.j: Jスルーカードについては、簡易改札機による対応のため複数枚の処理不可。
sen.e: More than one J Through Card cannot be handled by the simple ticket gate at once.
sen.cmt: 「同時に」または「一度に」というくだりがないと意味をなさないと判断し、そのように致しました。
sen.e: The simple ticket gate can't handle more than one J Through Card at a time.
The simple ticket gate can't handle more than one J-Through Card at a time.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約477人である。

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）12月1日 開業。
sen.e: December 1, 1952: Began its operation.
December 1, 1952: The station became operational.
December 1, 1952: The station became operational.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Became a station under the control of JR West with the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: It was placed under the control of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: It was placed under the control of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）3月11日 長尾～木津間電化に合わせ100m木津寄りの現在地に移転、簡易駅舎も設置された。
sen.e: March 11, 1989: With the electrification of the section between Nagao and Kizu, the location of the station was moved 100 m closer to Kizu and a new simple station building was set up.
March 11, 1989: With the electrification of the section between Nagao and Kizu, the station was relocated 100 meters closer to Kizu and a new simple station building was established.
March 11, 1989: With the electrification of the section between Nagao and Kizu, the station was relocated 100 meters closer to Kizu and a new simple station building was established.
